articles.title: Brain implant enables ALS patient to communicate using AI
articles.author: Kurt Knutsson
articles.summary: Brad G. Smith has been diagnosed with ALS, a rare and progressive disease that attacks the nerves controlling voluntary muscle movement. He is the first non-verbal person and only the third person worldwide to receive the Neuralink Brain-Computer Interface (BCI). The device, about as thick as five stacked coins, sits in his skull and connects to the motor cortex-the part of the brain that controls movement. It picks up signals from his neurons and sends them wirelessly to his MacBook Pro. The computer decodes these signals and moves the cursor on the screen with his thoughts alone.

articles.title: Why Rigetti Computing, Inc. (RGTI) Crashed On Friday
